Reviews.Title: “Much better than we expected”
Reviews.Author: helengarton
Reviews.Content: After reading a few reviews, we were not looking forward to it but it was great for what we wanted and paid for. Staff were very good, spoke perfect English. Local nearby resturaunts were good value and good food. The only noise we heard were other guests in the corridor going to their rooms.( And the Mosques of course) It is Turkey after all. It is a fair walk to the main attractions but we had fab weather so it wasnt a problem. The road back to the hotel did have street sellers at night but they were lovley lads and not threatning nor pushy.

Reviews.Title: “Average... Only Stay here if you getting a Steal...”
Reviews.Author: BrightspaceXL
Reviews.Content: I was here during Eid Holidays with my Wife. The hotel rooms are spacious and sufficiently large. But The location of the hotel is not ideal, any tourist place has to be visited using the tram or if you love long walks then it might suit you. The Red light district is located very close by that's another disadvantage if you are travelling with your family. Basically nothing is free in the hotel there is a charge to use anything & everything. Wifi is only available in the lobby and limited to 1 laptop per room. Overall, only if the deal is really great opt for this hotel....

Reviews.Title: “the black bird hotel at istambul”
Reviews.Author: fatima E
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the black bird hotel with my sister at the check in the hotel the front desk were not friendl they never explain or offer any information about the hotel they gave us the hotel key that have a different phone number abd address which cause me a big problem that put my sister and my life in danger due to two dishonest taxi drivers the 1st one drove around the city and never took us to the hotel and force me to pay him i was so scared his plate number is 34TJK38 his exuse that his taxi break down then another taxi driver stop by we ask him to take us to the black bird hotel cross from the mosque fatih he said he will take us him also drove around the city for more than 40 minutes his taxi plate number is 34 TDU 17 please be aware of this 2 they like to ripe off tourist our destination from the restaurant to the hotel was 12 minutes only but those 2 taxi driver were nothing but thieves. i had horible night i thought i will never make it to the hotel from 12 minutes ride went to 2 hours ride; when i ask for a front desk manager he was never present to take care of the guest issues.the room has no shampoo, no blanckets, and it look over craby old roofs.we had do not disturbe sign on the door the house keeping open our room door twice,we loved istambul and we try to keep this incidents behind, but the hotel employees should be more friendly and should look for the best stay of the guests.i will not stay in this hotel again,they are handred of hotel near the black bird.

Reviews.Title: “Functional, good location”
Reviews.Author: OGSBJ
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated in an excellent location for seeing Istanbul, Occassionally service slightly lacking, lovely little coffee shop at the front to watch the world go by, Night Club you can't get in as a male without your partner. Overall value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Bring your ear plugs!”
Reviews.Author: KayVancouver
Reviews.Content: Situated in a neither-here-nor-there location, the hotel was within walkable distance or an easy tram ride to the sites of Sultanahmet, without being in the midst of it all. Rooms were comfortable enough, but noise was pretty much a constant issue. First, the soundproofing in between rooms and floors is lacking -- we could clearly hear conversations in the room above ours, and once things got going in the hotel's night club, ear plugs became a basic necessity. The hotel rooms and corridors could use new carpeting, but things were clean enough. And breakfast was good, served in a huge, airy dining room. All in all, an okay bet -- but you can do better for the same price in Istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we'll be back”
Reviews.Author: SilvaSetubal
Reviews.Content: I installed this hotel on 18th to 22/05/2011. My opinion on evaluation criteria, considering the said 4 stars. Location: Optima, easy access to transport in general scope. Customer: Well, it was noted the efforts of employees in customer satisfaction. Room: Good state of repair / maintenance. Hygiene: good and timely, there was no unpleasant odor or outside the framework of the hotel unit. Breakfast: type of feeding varied and with a good service when needed. Thanks to employees and managers.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, large and clean rooms!”
Reviews.Author: Lennie57
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights and three days. Hotel staff was helpful and responsive. Overall, the hotel was clean and comfortable. The rooms were large and nicely furnished. We had a view of the street running in front of the hotel. Breakfast had many choices. However, when we were there the street was being worked on at night and there was a lot of noise. It is in a good location in the old city and we were able to walk from the spice market to the hotel. The tramway was close and made access to the Hagia Sophia and Grand Bazaar very easy. There was also easy access to the bus line and we were able to take a bus to Taksim. The only meal we ate at the hotel was breakfast. I'm not sure what the prices of the rooms are because we used a travel agent and had a package. It was recently remodeled and is very nice.

Reviews.Title: “it was fantastic”
Reviews.Author: istanbul_stanbul
Reviews.Content: A Heinrich BÃ¶ll Foundation group-tour, which I organized, stayed for one week in Hotel Blackbird in Istanbul. Our gasts were fascinated by the hotel, by the location, rooms, service and staff, they sent me a lot of e-mails to thank me, so we decided to work as from now with Hotel Blackbird. Thanks to the management and to the stuff off the Hotel! Dilman Muradoglu Heinrich BÃ¶ll Stiftung Istanbul

Reviews.Title: “History and Shopping with the Girls”
Reviews.Author: Pensioner99 Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel - clean, safe and comfortable; bedroom and bathroom were good - shower good too! We did not try the sauna etc nor did we try the wi-fi. The hotel advertises a disco - we heard nothing at all! Staff were friendly and helpful. The breakfast buffet was fresh and extensive - although could have done with a bit more fruit - perhaps it was the time of year. Evening meal choice was varied and tasty - the house white wine was very nice - and prices and quality compared very favourably with eating out - which we did as well. Close to the tram line for access to old and new city - although well within walking distance to the Grand Bazaar. The road outside the hotel was being re-laid with paviors and was almost finished - should look really good when completed.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, nice renovated rooms”
Reviews.Author: Ethem1973
Reviews.Content: I was at Blackbird Hotel during a business trip. My stay at the hotel was very good. The hotel is cental located near the most important sightseeing highlights and public transport is nearby. The breakfast was ideal and the room was in good shape. The staff of the hotel is very polite and friendly. Congratulations for the managing staff.

Reviews.Title: “perfect”
Reviews.Author: 123bp
Reviews.Content: I stayed 2 time this hotel.It si wonderfol hotel.BreÃ¡kfast and dinner was good.You canvisit old city by wolk.This hotel is very stuff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience Ä±n many ways...”
Reviews.Author: RAINBOW059
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took a trip to Ä°stanbul.We booked our hotel over the internet.We loved the hotel.Very frÄ±endly stuff,great food,great location,you can just walk around to see Sultanahmet ,Hagia Sophia,KapalicarsÄ± Bazaar,Topkapi Place etc.I really recommend this lovely hotel to anyone who is planning to go to Ä°stanbul and looking for a affordable but uxurious hotel in heart of Ä°stanbul We had a great experÄ±ence and thanks to Blackbird Hotel stuff for making our trip unforgettable...

Reviews.Title: “cheap and quality”
Reviews.Author: serdarefe
Reviews.Content: I was satisfied from everythink. the personel was wery polite and kitchen was great. also the persopnel was wery helpfull- the otel was near teh historical places.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: walk about, currently no home city
Reviews.Title: “RUN THE OTHER WAY”
Reviews.Author: daniellegage
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because I had one day in Istanbul after a 12 hour bus ride and before a 20 hour flight. I wanted to relax in the steam room, lay around and watch tv, and use the internet to make all of the connections and reservations necessary for my trip. I have been traveling for three months and this is by far the worst place I have stayed. The wifi was immediately an issue. They have four different connections, but non of them work. So they give you the pass code for the hotel across the street, which also stopped working. I stood there waiting for them to do something and they shook their heads as if I was asking for a blood donation. "you advertise wifi, I could have stayed at twenty different hotels..." At which point the manager was kind enough to then call three other hotels near by and get their wifi codes until one finally worked. Great. But, then, since it was a one time use code, every time I wanted to use my computer, I had to go through the same circus act. Why not just fix the wifi, they charge so much money for everything on site, I'm sure they can afford to correct the porblem. Then I asked for the front desk man to write down directions to the airport. He wrote down the name of the airport. no joke. And I said how do I get there? He said "taxi, half hour ride" That will cost 80 lira. I asked about a train, and he said no. Then said "oh metro" and pointed down the street. "can you please write down the directions to the metro?!" He pulled out a map and pointed and gave me the paper with the airport written on it. What service. The room? The tv is about 8inches long and has a high pitched squealing back round noise that comes with the volume. IT's noisy, and the AC is as loud as the tv screaming. The room was dingy and not what is pictured, the only thing in their mini fridge was beer, coke and fanta, the room service menu had no prices so I'm sure they will charge you 20lira for a salad, since they charge 5lira for a cup of nescafe. The shower has no shampoo, soap, conditioner or even washcloths! The "spa" is also a rip off. They charge you 60 lira for a hamam treatment but, it lasts approximately 15 minutes. And, no, it wasn't busy, I was the only one there. To use just the steam room, it costs 20 Lira, but, they make it seem like it comes with the hotel cost on all of the websites of course. This place is a service disaster. For sixty bucks a night, you can go stay in a hostel, pay the extra money for a double occupancy room and have a much more restful stay with way kinder service and working internet.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, nice location”
Reviews.Author: Goodsport01
Reviews.Content: Not a 4 star; more like a 3. Good size rooms. Cleaned every day but sheets not changed. Breakfast was good and replenished as required. Staff helpful. Location ok but you need to catch a tram or taxi to the main sites. Grand Bazaar is about a 10 minute walk away. The area itself has many wholesale stores and a lot of Russians.

Reviews.Title: “it is a horrible place”
Reviews.Author: 1001nights
Reviews.Content: Dear Traveller I stayed in Black Bird hotel and it was a very bad experience. I came to Istanbul for business trip with my 2 colleagues, we stayed in 3 beds room that designed for 2 bed. the room was smell like a bar and the place was very little. I completely suggest you to go to another hotel. Also do not trust night clubs at all. regards

Reviews.Title: “Truely Aweful - Terrible Service, Terrible Food, Terrible Value”
Reviews.Author: HotelMasterUk
Reviews.Content: I must say that I have travelled to alot of countries in the past and stayed in hundreds of hotels. This is truely one of the worst hotels I have ever stayed in. On the first night they said they had double booked our rooms and promised us a free meal and sauna. We were dumped in a hotel down the road and when we turned up for the free meal the food was astonishingly bad. We were given food which looked like it had been cooked weeks in advance and tasted roughly the same. None of us could finish our meal. But alas, the nightmare continued as when we got into our rooms the following night we found things like a soap dispenser where the soap had been there so long it had separated and a smoke detector which had been painted over. We thought all was not lost the following morning when we went down for breakfast. It was obvious that nothing was fresh as the meat had been there so long it had discoloured and started curling. Don't even get me started on the coffee, the watered down cherry juice or the cost of the orange juice for a breakfast which was meant to be all inclusive. However, being an optimistic family we decided to check out the free sauna. We went to explore the turkish bath facility and I can safely say that if you wish to have a turkish bath at the Blackbird then my simple advice is: don't. All in all the Blackbird Hotel is aweful. I hope you will heed my advice and not visit.

Reviews.Title: “Keep your secrets out of the bathroom”
Reviews.Author: twoguystravelling
Reviews.Content: Rooms are comfortable and clean. Bit noisy at night- the hotel is located in the fabric market area and they work noisly until late at night. The breakfasts are acceptable -staff are at best functional. Be very aware that the bathrooms back onto each other (with the next room) and there is a common roof space - yep, they can hear everything you say and every drip drop and splash not the place to "debrief" about your friends in the next room! The coffee shop downstairs is expensive. Late night wanderings are a no as the area becomes a bit "rough". Nice trutkish delight shop down the hill 10 mins to main road and turn left.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely use this hotel again”
Reviews.Author: Sara2323
Reviews.Content: Was a pleasant stay, clean and friendly staff. Rooms were good sizes, rooms were cleaned every day. Food offered for breakfast was nice. Don't go through the hotel for excursions, very expensive. We visited the area Sultan Ahmet a lot (near the Blue Mosque) and there are plenty of agents that offer excursions there that are a lot cheaper, about 10-15 minute walk from the hotel. Overall had a pleasant stay in the Black bird, only one thing i didn't like about the hotel was the noise from the club which is situated in the basement. Although it wasn't too noisy i would be weary of this if your a very light sleeper. Second time I've been to Istanbul and would recommend this hotel to anyone, especially if you plan not to stay in the hotel for a majority of your time. Booked through www.beatthebrochure.com. Prices for flights and hotel was very very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “bad location for 2 girls, nice breakfast, ok room”
Reviews.Author: lolalala69
Reviews.Content: The room was ok and the breakfast was really nice, but the location was not so good because it's a bad neighbourhood and kind of far from the main attractions.. (So we were lucky that two guys wanted to bring us back to the hotel at night, because I don't know what would have happened when we walked alone..) The facilities like sauna etc. didn't look that great and kind of expensive, so we didn't use them. The people at the reception were nice and 24/7 available. It was hard to get to the hotel from the airport (we went with a shuttle but it was to far to walk to the hotel, so we had to take a taxi as well but that took the guy sooo long so it was really expensive..) The hotel itself was ok and looked nice, but the room was not so big and there were hairs in the shower..

Reviews.Title: “clean but can be noisy”
Reviews.Author: various
Reviews.Content: The hotel is clean and in a good location. The breakfast was adequate and edible. The one potential problem with the hotel is the nightclub underneath it. Some parts of the 1st floor are subject to a boom, boom boom until 4 in the morning. Other parts of the hotel may also be subject to this noise. We stayed in winter and they moved us to the 5th floor where we were not disturbed. Unless you are out or in the nightclub I would make sure this is not a problem in your room.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Clean Rooms”
Reviews.Author: LorenzoL3
Reviews.Content: We checked into the Blackbird Hotel for a family holiday for four nights. The taxi from the airport cost 30 Lira. The location is good, only a 5 minute walk from the overground tram that will take you to the Hagia Spohia in about 10 minutes for 1.40 Lira. Aksaray is the nearest tram station. The tram line will also take you to the Grand Bazaar, Spice Bazaar and the Asian side of the city. In the other direction you are a short walk to the Valens Aqueduct and the Sulleymane Mosque. There are also plenty of little shops nearby where you can pick up some essentials and a cafes which serve good food. The hotel rooms were clean and quite spacious but dont expect any toiletries etc apart from a squeezy bodywash fixed on the wall by the bath. We has a decent view of one of the mosques as we were at the front of the hotel. However, if you are in a room facing the road expect to hear some car horns from around 7am in the morning. We were on the third floor and we could not hear the noise from the bar/club downstairs and the rooms away from the street are quiet. Some staff members could speak good english and all were polite and helpful. There is a security guard outside the front door for most of the day and the place felt safe. There is a charge for use of the sauna and the gym which is a bit dissapointing but breakfast was nice with cold meats, cheese, cereal and fresh bread on offer. One negative point is that the area around the tram stop after 9pm is not the most pleasant. It is not threatening but there are people selling counterfeit goods on the street and groups of 3-4 men hanging around shop fronts looking shifty. Every so often someone will try to speak to you to offer something illicit but if you are firm with them and keep walking they leave you alone. The good news is that this is along the main road where the tram runs and not within 1/4 mile of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and clean place - english is a problem...”
Reviews.Author: 2be
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very clean, nice crew, unlike other hotels in the old city - the room has a reasonable size. We try to get some info from the reception desk (weather, transport etc) no english - no luck :P breakfast was great: 4 types of bread ,about 5 types of cheese, vegetables, watermelon, cornflakes, cakes , coffee machine and more... you need to pay 6 lita!! for a fresh orange juice.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for a city trip”
Reviews.Author: arnoutarnout
Reviews.Content: We went on a city trip to Istanbul and stayed in the Black Bird for 4 nights. Since we were out into town most of the time and therefore did not spend much time in the hotel I cannot comment on all the extra facilities they have (sauna, massage, solarium, hair dresser, disco, ice cream shop etc. etc.). I do want to mention breakfast (buffet) which was really good with lots of choice (excellent bread). Also the reception is open 24h which is nice. The room was ok, nothing more nothing less. Make sure to get one on 3rd floor or higher because of the disco beats from below. Location of the hotel is not bad but don't expect a stunning sight or vibrant street life. It's however located close to Istanbuls booming centre. We went down the street to the first tram station and travelled form there. All in all we had a good stay in a great city.

Reviews.Title: “Tolerable for the Price”
Reviews.Author: Trailing-Spouse
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at the Black BIrd Hotel in Istanbul for three nights. The internet advertising makes it look fantastic. It wasn't. There are no non-smoking rooms so all rooms are permeated with the smell of cigarettes. The facilites are shabby but the location is great, close to the tram that takes you to all the sights. The breakfast was good with lots of fresh breads, eggs, omelets on demand and a vast assortment of cheese, meats, cereal, fruit etc. The staff is very friendly and trys to be helpful. The price is very reasonable and this hotel seems to specialize in tour groups.

HotelInfo.Name: Blackbird Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Gencturk Cad No 51 - 53 | Sehzadebasi, Istanbul 34740, Turkey
